scenarioDescription:
The HD 22496 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 22496 is a star with 0.68 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.67 times its radius. It is located 44.34 light years away from the solar system.

HD 22496 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 22496 system


HD 22496 b

HD 22496 b was discovered by the Paranal Observatory observatory, in 2021-09, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.05 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 22496 b is 5.575 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 22496 b is 2.220 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 22496 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 22496, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Paranal Observatory.
name: HD 22496 - System With 1 Exoplanet
